articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: U.S. gave Britain new evidence of 'madness' of using Huawei in 5G network -report
articles.description: U.S. government officials presented the British government with new evidence on Monday about the risks of including Huawei [HWT.UL] equipment in future 5G mobile networks, branding it "madness", the Guardian newspaper reported.
articles.content:
LONDON (Reuters) - U.S. government officials presented the British government with new evidence on Monday about the risks of including Huawei [HWT.UL] equipment in future 5G mobile networks, branding it “madness”, the Guardian newspaper reported.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Queen agrees to let Prince Harry and Meghan go it alone
articles.description: Britain’s Queen Elizabeth has given her blessing to grandson Prince Harry and his wife Meghan’s wish for a more independent future following crisis talks involving the most senior members of the royal family. Lisa Bernhard has more.
articles.content:
Posted 
Britains Queen Elizabeth has given her blessing to grandson Prince Harry and his wife Meghans wish for a more independent future following crisis talks involving the most senior members of the royal family. Lisa Bernhard has more.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Turkish, Syrian top spies meet in first official contact in years
articles.description: Turkish and Syrian heads of intelligence met in Moscow on Monday, in the first official contact in years despite Ankara's long-standing hostility to President Bashar al-Assad, a senior Turkish official and Syrian news agency SANA said.
articles.content:
ANKARA (Reuters) - Turkish and Syrian heads of intelligence met in Moscow on Monday, in the first official contact in years despite Ankara’s long-standing hostility to President Bashar al-Assad, a senior Turkish official and Syrian news agency SANA said.

articles.author: Stefanie Eschenbacher
articles.title: Political vacuum in Haiti could let president rule single-handedly
articles.description: Haitian President Jovenel Moise could be ruling by decree later this week, a scenario he said would help break the Caribbean nation's political deadlock but which critics fear will undermine its fragile democracy.
articles.content:
PORT-AU-PRINCE (Reuters) - Haitian President Jovenel Moise could be ruling by decree later this week, a scenario he said would help break the Caribbean nation’s political deadlock but which critics fear will undermine its fragile democracy.

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: How troops in Iraq escaped a devastating attack
articles.description: Nearly eight hours before Iran’s Jan. 8 missile attack on U.S. forces at bases in Iraq, American and Iraqi soldiers at Ain al-Asad air base scrambled to move personnel and weaponry to fortified bunkers. Gavino Garay reports.
articles.content:
Posted 
Nearly eight hours before Irans Jan. 8 missile attack on U.S. forces at bases in Iraq, American and Iraqi soldiers at Ain al-Asad air base scrambled to move personnel and weaponry to fortified bunkers. Gavino Garay reports.

articles.title: Total says Donges refinery is being resupplied
articles.description: Oil major Total on Monday said its Donges refinery in western France was being supplied again after a weekend blockade in the port of Saint-Nazaire due to a nationwide strike over the government's pensions reform had been lifted.
articles.content:

articles.title: Visa nearing a deal to buy fintech startup Plaid - WSJ
articles.description: Visa Inc is nearing an agreement to buy privately held financial technology startup Plaid Inc and a deal could be announced over the week, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.
articles.content:

articles.title: Pompeo: Soleimani was plotting 'imminent attacks'
articles.description: Responding to a question on why the American people should trust U.S. intelligence on the imminent threat posed by Qassem Soleimani, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said agency personnel do their 'best' to present intelligence accurately.
articles.content:
Posted 
Responding to a question on why the American people should trust U.S. intelligence on the imminent threat posed by Qassem Soleimani, Secretary of State Mike Pompeo said agency personnel do their 'best' to present intelligence accurately.

articles.title: RPT-UPDATE 3-India orders antitrust probe of Amazon, Walmart's Flipkart
articles.description: India ordered an investigation of Amazon.com Inc and Walmart's Flipkart on Monday over alleged violations of competition law in the latest setback for U.S. e-commerce giants operating in the country.
